title.bibl: Revyen, June 24, 1905. [Danish Church Decides to Build Children's Home in Chicago]

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Revyen, June 24, 1905. [DANISH CHURCH DECIDES TO BUILD CHILDREN'S HOME IN CHICAGO]

body.p: The annual meeting of the Danish Church, in Tyler, Minnesota, was attended by forty-one ministers and sixty delegates from the different congregations. There were also four hundred visitors from all parts of the country.

The convention decided that a new Danish Children's Home should be built in Chicago, near Humboldt Park, at a cost not to exceed $16,000. A Danish day school will be established in connection with the Home.
